page.title: 06GLYNDE CHURCH
page.content: Glynde church is different from other churches in strange ways. It has a flattish roof which is unusual, for most churches have a roof which slants up to a point. It was built in 1763. It took from 1763 - 1765 to build. That was when they changed it because the first one was built long before. It was built by{Richard {Trevor,}Bishop of Durham. Inside it has pews with doors to get into them. There are some stairs going up into a balcony with an organ up there. It has two doors, the outer doors which are wooden and rather heavy. The inner door is a network of metal. The vicar is the vicar of{Beddingham, Firle}and Glynde. He lives in Firle. South of the church is a bank of daffodils in spring. Glynde parish church is next to Glynde place.
